audit_tests.name: 4.1.1 Ensure that the kubelet service file permissions are set to 644 or more restrictive
audit_tests.description: Ensure that the kubelet service file has permissions of 644 or more restrictive.
audit_tests.remediation:
Run the below command (based on the file location on your system) on the each worker node. For example,
chmod 755 /etc/systemd/system/kubelet.service.d/10-kubeadm.conf
audit_tests.default_value: By default, the kubelet service file has permissions of 640.

audit_tests.name: 4.1.2 Ensure that the kubelet service file ownership is set to root:root
audit_tests.description: Ensure that the kubelet service file ownership is set to root:root.
audit_tests.remediation:
Run the below command (based on the file location on your system) on the each worker node. For example,
chown root:root /etc/systemd/system/kubelet.service.d/10-kubeadm.conf
audit_tests.default_value: By default, kubelet service file ownership is set to root:root.

audit_tests.name: 4.1.3 If proxy kubeconfig file exists ensure permissions are set to 644 or more restrictive
audit_tests.description: If kube-proxy is running, and if it is using a file-based kubeconfig file, ensure that the proxy kubeconfig file has permissions of 644 or more restrictive.
audit_tests.remediation:
Remediation:
Run the below command (based on the file location on your system) on the each worker node. For example,
chmod 644 <proxy kubeconfig file>
audit_tests.default_value: By default, proxy file has permissions of 640.
